q.q: hey so you were wondering if the gift shop of mt. st. helens is still "there" but I'm curious if you thought the chord on "there" was too regular as just a little 2 5,

q.a: the first way it came to me was as it is. when i went to work out the details, i refined it to actually be F over Bb (on "there") was more shiny and exotic that way, and seemed cool because that would actually make it nearly exactly how it happened on "grey" at the same time in the first verse except a half step higher. so i thought that would be the right answer, but then upon run-through in wider context it instantly felt wrong, and it was immediately clear that the way i first had it was better so i switched it back. sometimes what seems to work up close just doesn't work in the real time flow of the song in wider context. that's why full run throughs (like from the beginning) are so important, and the only way to find out what's really gonna work

q.q: and I don't know you, but based on what you've said over the years, I'm guessing people (family?) forced "help" on you when you were younger to try to get you to conform to some shit ideal they had for who they wanted you to be. I'm very sorry that happened. That's not fucking okay. Sure, you're eccentric and unique and innovative and genius and "weird"... and as long as you're happy and you're not hurting anyone, you should be able to do and be and live whatever and however the fuck you want. Always. Period. I will fight til the death for your right to be as free and insane as makes you happy. But your needs and experiences aren't everyone's needs and experiences. Some people need therapy and meds to achieve basic functioning and baseline peace or to tak e care o f their kids or to take care of themselves or whatever the fuck it is that they need to do in this life... and I am clearly one of them. And when you think you're just hating on quack doctors, you're also shitting on the good ones who save lives and help give people skills that transform their lives for the better. And you're making people feel bad for not being as "strong" or as "free" as your online persona proports to be. It should come as no surprise to you that I quit taking my meds when I first started following you early this year because I thought "if he doesn't need them, then I don't either!"... and how did that turn out? Pretty fucking badly, I guess... right? So maybe just chill the fuck out for a minute and stop trying to convince everyone to get off their meds unless you're actively trying to get people to become creepy obsessive unhinged lovesick psychos when their brain chemistry jumps off the deep end. https://www.reddit.com/r/billwurtz/comments/9h5zc7/whoa/

q.a: you know how a major chord has one note different from a minor chord .... well a 'power chord' is when you don't play that note at all. just the 1 and 5. probably has the most 'power' when it's played on guitar with some distortion, in low range with another octave on top. so low E, B, E. or G, D, G. used all the time in distorted guitar music because major/minor intervals start to crap out when the distortion comes on, and also don't work in the low range. 'power chords' seem most at home in a reasonably low range, around the low area of a guitar. not to be confused with 'power cord' which provides electricity for the chord

q.a: one weird weird thing i noticed, i was mixing hallelujah for way way too long and feeling trapped and down about it, listening to 'new rules' side-by-side with it and just wanting to die over it, (by the way this was just days before i found out the loudness war is officially over. so now we don't have to worry about that which is huge huge news, but this was right before i realized that) anyway, i had done all this work on the mix for hallelujah, and it's also just a really dense and layered textural arrangement, etc, and whatever, and then i was poking around for reference songs (such as new rules and several other songs done by other people) and was generally freaking out about how much clearer everyone else's songs sounded but (i'm getting to the point of this, hold on) here's the surprise: i accidentally opened up one of my jazz jam sessions (like anything you would hear on the 'jazz' section of this site) and i was shocked to find out that that recording sounded so much more clear, sounded like it was mixed much much better, but as we all know it is not even mixed at all. those are instrumental jams where i lay down each instrument in 1 crazy take, bounce it out and call it a day. and the point is, i found out that that mix (which was no mix) had a lot more punch and clarity than this hallelujah mix which i had so tenderly spent so many long days on. the lesson was , ...... if you use a million instruments it is a real challenge to mix it out of sounding like mud. even if it's very tenderly layered and arranged instruments, the point is, if there are many instruments, they will clog up the mid range, like that troublesome 100-300 range. but if you use only 3 or 4 instruments,  ..... it's just got automatic clarity. so that's something. so this works to my advantage now working under these crazy deadline schedules, because i simply don't have time to make as dense an arrangement, and it is therefore easier to mix. Another thing i learned, on the subject of working faster, is, ... work faster. you gravitate toward what matters. and it is so easy to lose your mind if you listen to that damn thing for too long. you'll just lose your mind ...... another way to get tips is watching a billion mixing tutorials and tips videos until you realize they are all starting to contradict each other, and then you forget it and do what you want

q.a: the mix didn't get the same level of attention as it did in the previous songs. there's probably too much of a general bulge around 200hz. to fix that you just have to crawl thru every instrument and figure out what to cut, and when. actually on the last 2 songs i went through the vocal and made very specific eq cuts custom to each word. it made a big difference especially for the car, because the car system is very volatile and sensitive. i didn't have time to do any of that. but, i did do what's absolutely necessary. in fact, when you have limited time, sometimes you resort to arrangement changes if something is not working. for example, the "not gonna happen" section was muddy and lumpy as hell, and normally i probably would have gone crazy cutting frequencies from vocals, background vocals, instruments, really just slaved over it. but instead i went back in and just added some drums, made some quicker fixes which might have had more impact. the important thing is, if you stay working on it too long, self doubt starts to set in

oh, now i get it. i come here and start talking to myself. forgetting to communicate. just thinking to self. forget to cut the thread until i realize how long it's gone. first i thought it needed to keep going because i hadn't made my 'point' yet. there's not a special point. it's just that if you keep thinking what you mean more meaning will be there and at the end there will be a wide horizon of truth and you look out at it and see something at some point that feels like 'it'. it can be cut off at any point. you realized that. but then you figured, well, if it can stop now, it can also continue. then i'll Really have some points!.. nah. it's just a window of insanity. insanity can carry meaning. wait, what's insanity? you think of it as disjointed from reality. rambling, sprawling, the focus tumbling forward and out and everywhere. it's inevitable that it catches on something important if you can still see that through the mess.    messy. messy? it's messy without focus. no filler allowed. what is the filler? how do i know which words are the fluff? the fluff diverts the focus. what is the focus? how do you know? you don't know when you do this. you're just thinking. you're just thinking. you're just thinking. you're just thinking. oh no. i didn't come here to do this. i came here to be focused. focus. use your 10. not your 2. this is the lab. yes. it's the lab. you can do anything in the lab. but you have to have a plan. the plan can be to have no plan. but that needs to be a choice. not your always. what you need is to distill the meaning. add fun, stir, enjoy. but don't waste time.

if you want to communicate, and you do, you need to have a point and it needs to be understood, and the process of the end-consumer understanding it needs to feel easy and good. that can be difficult to gauge when it's your own thoughts. you may confuse articulating your thoughts as they appeared as making them understandable to others and the contact high from having just recently handled the spicy crazy fun with having made something that is fun to experience as a separate person. what you need is to learn how to see the end product as a separate person. that's a different suit. you gotta be you when you're doing it, or what the hell is it gonna be?

what i'm doing right now is tricking my brain into going into communication mode while in a mostly-safe environment. i feel i'm gaining a better understanding of what's going on here. most of that information comes from doing it wrong. the next step is to become comfortable doing this in a completely independent environment, learn to accurately evaluate performance, and plan the appropriate next steps + the upcoming destinations + the long-term journey.

the obvious next step is to try some fiction. stories. deliberate things that don't have your immediate thoughts tied up into it. that's great practice for fun, clear, purpose-driven communication. extra bonus, if you come up for air and feel ready to express yourself in a straightforward way, you'll be even better at communicating and you'll have new things to say.

No such thing as an objective truth--- or at least there is as much objectivity in our universe as there is subjectivity--- Our realities are bounded by our sensory abilities and as everything in the universe is defined by the laws of cause and effect, we can assume that for all things and non-things (and things in-between things and non-things), a set path of event-to-events is in place as far as our perception of reality allows. I.e. if the exact circumstances that caused the creation of our universe were to reoccur in the exact same way, then every following time-related outcome would be identical. Every life, death, thought, personality, choice, etc. is predetermined, like an elaborate Rube Goldberg machine with a few of the components trying to rationalize their place in the whole thing.

q.a: there's a weird and cool technique you can do. actually there's 2. one is keep your head pointing straight forward. sometimes you think you want to sing the note up. you don't need to do that. sing it straight across even if it's high. but the other really crazy trick, this is a psychological trick, pretend you are singing down to the note. pretend it's not the highest note you can sing. pretend it's a low note and sing down to the note. like pretend you can sing way higher and sing down to it. here's another trick, this one comes from tony robbins, just close your eyes and imagine yourself singing the note clearly and beautifully. just visualize it happening, 10 times in a row. now try it. these are all interesting tricks. but don't forget to warm up before doing high notes and don't push hard, and if it hurts don't do it

q.a: i used to writethe chart on staff paper but i no longer use any paper. i use a textfile and audio recordings. the lyrics are written in the text, andnext to each line (maybe every 2 lines or every 4 lines) there is thefile name of the audio reference. when the song is done you mightoften see a file name at the top of the page for a full run thru. thenoften when starting the arrangement, i will whip up a "studio chart"(really just chords) based on the run-thru, and put it on paper justto have something on the stand to look at in the empty beginningstages of the arrangement. but pretty soon as things get filled in iwouldn't need it anymore because it's all in there. and then whendoing vocals i may type up a lyric cheat sheet. sometimes i mayreference the demo run-thru if i want to confirm what the exact melodywas
